shortDescription: Draw a group of adjacent Sprites.
longDescription:
Draw a group of adjacent Sprites from the sprites sheet.
Like a 16x16 group, which is made of 4 sprites.
notes: This method draws the sprites group from it's top-left corner.
This method uses the SpriteMap global as the default SpriteSheet, and would fail if it's invalid!
The sprites of the sprite group are drawn individually, and so that might cause performance issues for large groups.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The ID of the top-left sprite, as displayed in the Sprites Editor

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X coord to draw the sprites group at.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y coord to draw the sprites group at.

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: The width of the sprites group in sprites. (ex: 2 for a 16x16 sprites group).

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: The height of the sprites group in sprites. (ex: 2 for a 16x16 sprites group).

arguments.name: sx
arguments.description: The scale factor of the sprite's width.

arguments.name: sy
arguments.description: The scale factor of the sprite's height.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The rotation of the sprites group in radian, costs little bit more performance.

arguments.name: sheet
arguments.description: The spritesheet to pick the sprites from.
